name: Support Preserve Afrika!
description: The indigenous people, the indigenous animals, and the beautiful landforms need your help! Without your help, natural Afrika will be gone in only a matter of years. Please donate today in order to help the growth of our organization. Every dollar counts so please allow Preserve Afrika to become something and give your gift today!

name: Support The Wildlife And The Land Of Afrika Through African Wildlife Foundation
description:
As of now, Preserve Afrika is acting as a fundraising partner for Cultural Survival and African Wildlife Foundation. All donations given to Preserve Afrika will go directly, 100% towards either organization's Afrika division depending on which donation package you choose. 

From African Wildlife Foundation:

Our Mission: The African Wildlife Foundation, together with the people of Africa, works to ensure the wildlife and wild lands of Africa will endure forever.

The African Wildlife Foundation (AWF) is the leading international conservation organization focused solely on Africa. We believe that protecting Africa’s wildlife and wild landscapes is the key to the future prosperity of Africa and its people – and for over 50 years, we have made it our work to help ensure that Africa’s wild resources endure.

Read more from Preserve Afrika at www.preserveafrika.blogspot.com
Read more from African Wildlife Foundation at www.awf.org

name: Support The Indigenous People Of Afrika Through Cultural Survival
description:
As of now, Preserve Afrika is acting as a fundraising partner for Cultural Survival and African Wildlife Foundation. All donations given to Preserve Afrika will go directly, 100% towards either organization's Afrika division depending on which donation package you choose. 

From Cultural Survival:

For nearly 40 years Cultural Survival has partnered with Indigenous communities around the world to help them defend their lands, languages, and cultures.

Our work is predicated on the United Nations Declaration on the Rights of Indigenous Peoples. We publicize Indigenous Peoples' issues through our award-winning publications; we mount letter-writing campaigns and other advocacy efforts to stop environmental destruction and abuses of Native Peoples' rights; and we work on the ground in Indigenous communities, always at their invitation. Our board of directors includes some of the world's preeminent Indigenous leaders, and our staff, headed by Navajo/Santa Clara Tewa environmental expert Suzanne Benally, includes both Indigenous and non-Indigenous members. Our headquarters is in Cambridge, Massachusetts, and we have satellite offices in Guatemala and Colorado. Cultural Survival has consultative status with the United Nations.

The most important member of our team is you. None of our work would be possible without our members. Please make a donation to become a member today.

Read more from Preserve Afrika at www.preserveafrika.wordpress.com
Read more from Cultural Survival at culturalsurvival.org
